invoker

Class CommandInvoker

  • java.lang.Object
    • invoker.CommandInvoker
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CommandInvokerService

    public class CommandInvoker
extends Object
implements CommandInvokerService
    Invokes commands from a command string passed.
    Command-Pattern: Invoker

    Responsibilities:
    • asks the command to carry out the request. This is performed by executeCommand.
    • this class in independent of any concrete output channel like console, terminal, ... This is ensured by the outputter interface.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addCommand(Command cmd)
      Adds a new command to the list of active commands.
      void executeCommand(String command, Outputter outputter)
      Interprets a command string, executes if an appropriate command is found and returns all output via the outputter interface.
      void setCommands(ArrayList<Command> commands)
      Sets the list of active commands.

    • Method Detail

      • setCommands

        public void setCommands(ArrayList<Command> commands)
        Sets the list of active commands.
        Important: The current list is overwritten. This operation is intended to be used by the CommandFactory only at startup to set the reference to the correct list. Use addCommand() for further expansions.
        Parameters:
        commands - Reference to the list of active commands created by the factory.

      • addCommand

        public void addCommand(Command cmd)
        Adds a new command to the list of active commands.
        Parameters:
        cmd - New command which should be available by now.

      • executeCommand

        public void executeCommand(String command,
                           Outputter outputter)
        Description copied from interface: CommandInvokerService
        Interprets a command string, executes if an appropriate command is found and returns all output via the outputter interface.
        Specified by:
        executeCommand in interface CommandInvokerService
        Parameters:
        command - String which is entered, containing the command and the parameters.
        outputter - Implementation of the outputter interface to which the output text is sent.
